nodes.title: City Council Approves Brandywine Development 4-1
nodes.description:
Thanks for all of your support. Unfortunately, the only council member that voted in our favor was Bruce Whitaker.    

Jan Flory, Jennifer Fitzgerald, Ahmad Zahra and Jesus Silva voted in favor of this development without any further conditions or research. They basically said we are lucky it is only 33 units.

The only thing they did was make a motion to discuss Bastanchury's general safety at a further date. They also encouraged Brandywine to stay in contact with the school on a monthly basis over dust and noise disturbances but did not require them to physically monitor air quality which some parents were very concerned about. 

Make sure you show up at the polls if you are disappointed with this outcome. 

All the best, Kelly

nodes.title: Last push for signatures.
nodes.description:
Hi friends, 

We only have 2 more days to collect signatures. Please help us by sending to 10 people you know that live in the city of Fullerton. We appreciate it and hope to see you at the meeting on Tuesday night . If not, I will be delivering all of your comments to each member of City Council. 

Thanks!

nodes.title: Fullerton City Council Meeting Confirmed for Tuesday, February 4th  @ 6:30pm
nodes.description:
Hi everyone, 

I confirmed with Matt Foulkes, the Directory of Community and Economic Development, that this development will be discussed by City Council on Feb 4th at 6:30pm. Please mark your calendar and attend. We need bodies in the room. The address is 303 W Commonwealth Ave. Fullerton, CA 92832

Thanks!!!!!
